intro: Erythranthe naiandina, commonly known as the Sierra foothill monkeyflower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its striking red to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils along streambanks and in open woodlands. It has opposite, linear to lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Erythranthe naiandina plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is a subject of interest in botanical conservation efforts.
